intro: Eriosema verdickii var. verdickii, commonly known as the velvetleaf eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a hairy, glandular surface that gives it a distinctive velvety appearance. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its flowers bloom in spring and are visited by various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
